decoupling_requirements.reason: 10µF bulk capacitor essential - ESP32 draws 500mA+ peaks during WiFi TX. Insufficient capacitance causes brownouts and resets.
100nF bypass cap for high-frequency filtering close to power pins.

external_components.reason: EN pin requires 10k pull-up to VDD. Without it, module may not start reliably.
100nF cap on EN to GND creates RC delay for proper power-on sequencing. Prevents startup issues.

pin_requirements.reason: EN needs RC delay (10k + 100nF) for reliable startup. The delay ensures power is stable before chip enables.
GPIO0 is a strapping pin - must be HIGH at boot for normal operation, LOW for download mode. Add 10k pull-up.
GPIO2 must be LOW or floating at boot. If connected to external pull-up, boot may fail.
GPIO12 (MTDI) sets flash voltage at boot. Must be LOW for 3.3V flash (default). HIGH selects 1.8V.
GPIO15 (MTDO) controls debug output at boot. Pull-down silences boot messages on UART0.

warnings: Keep antenna area clear of copper pour and components
Do not place ground plane under antenna
Strapping pins (GPIO0,2,12,15) must be in correct state at power-on
Power supply must handle 500mA peaks during WiFi transmission
